Objects.Name: tea cup tea
Objects.Description: A cup has been set here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: It is a small simple cup.

Objects.Name: milk cup milk
Objects.Description: A cup has been set here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: It is a small simple cup.

Objects.Name: water cup water
Objects.Description: A cup has been set here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: It is a large simple cup.

Objects.Name: water bottle water
Objects.Description: A bottle of Evian natural spring water is here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: You've been ripped off!  It says here at the bottom of the label, in reallyreally small letters, 'Bottled in the Midgaard branch of Evian Inc.  This wateris from the natural, mostly clean River of Midgaard.  '

Objects.Name: water canteen water
Objects.Description: A canteen has been set on the ground here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: It is a fairly big canteen.  Looks like it can hold a lot of liquid.

Objects.Name: red usher usher's vest
Objects.Description: A red ushers vest has been left here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This vest is made out of thick cloth.  It has bright gold buttons runningdown the middle of it, and it has two small pockets on either side.

Objects.Name: flashlight flash light
Objects.Description: A small black metal flashlight is lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This is a small flashlight, used by the ushers at the theater.

Objects.Name: leather work gloves
Objects.ShortDescription: a pair of leather work gloves
Objects.Description: A pair of thick leather work gloves have been left here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This pair of gloves looks fairly new.  The palms have an extra strip ofleather across them, while the tops have a layer of thick yellow fabric.

Objects.Name: denim overalls
Objects.Description: A pair of denim overalls have been discarded here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This pair of overalls looks quite big.  They're a dark blue color, with alarge pocket over the chest.

Objects.Name: expensive suit jacket
Objects.Description: An expensive looking black suit jacket is sitting here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This jacket looks pretty nice.  It seems to fit you perfectly.

Objects.Name: white dress shirt
Objects.Description: A white dress shirt has been neatly folded here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: The shirt has no patterns or colors on it whatsover.  It's a thin whiteshirt with white buttons.

Objects.Name: black dress pants
Objects.ShortDescription: a pair of black dress pants
Objects.Description: A pair of black dress pants is lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This pair of dress pants feel soft, and seem to fit you well.

Objects.Name: leather dress shoes
Objects.ShortDescription: a pair of men's leather dress shoes
Objects.Description: A pair of men's black leather dress shoes are sitting here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: These shoes look quite comfortable.  The leather is soft, and has anelaborate pattern printed on it.

Objects.Name: fancy dress
Objects.Description: A fancy black dress has been left here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This dress is very nice.  It's rather tight, but it fits you quite well.

Objects.Name: dress heels
Objects.Description: A pair of women's dress heels are sitting here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: These shoes look quite comfortable.  The leather is soft, the heels aren'ttoo high.

Objects.Name: black bow tie
Objects.Description: A black bow tie is here, waiting for you to pick it up.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This bow tie looks brand new.  It would go well with a suit.

Objects.Name: key city
Objects.Description: The very big City Key is lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: It is probably the biggest key you have seen in your life.  It is made frompolished gold and has various patterns on it along with the Midgaard Coat ofArms.

Objects.Name: pda personal digital assistant
Objects.Description: A PDA (Personal Digital Assistant) is lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This PDA looks pretty complicated.  It's a small black box, about the size ofa small book.  On the screen are several icons.

Objects.Name: cell phone cellphone
Objects.Description: A black cell phone is here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: A cellphone is a pretty worthless item.  Why use a cellphone when you can usea regular phone?  And besides, on a MUD, you can magically communicate withoutphones anyway.

Objects.Name: laptop lap top
Objects.Description: A brand new laptop is here, waiting to be stolen.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This laptop looks brand new.  Black in color, it features a 1.  6 GHzprocessor, 512 MB of RAM, a 64 MB video card, and a 40x DVD/CD burner.  Prettyfancy.

Objects.Name: sack coins gold
Objects.ShortDescription: a huge sack of gold coins
Objects.Description: A huge sack of gold coins sits here.

Objects.Name: sword long
Objects.Description: A long sword has been left here.

Objects.Name: meat chunk
Objects.Description: A rather dubious looking piece of meat is on the ground here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: It isn't so much that the meat looks poisoned or anything, but that you justare not sure of its origins.  You doubt that a hunter would drop a side ofvenison or rabbit meat...  What in the world could this meat have come from, youwonder...

Objects.Name: script first 1 one
Objects.ShortDescription: the first page of a script
Objects.Description: The first page of a play script is lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: x-------------------------------------------------x   |                                            pg 1 |   |           THE STREET VENDOR FROM HELL           |   |                   by Crazyman                   |   |                                                 |   |  (The play begins on a street in downtown       |   |  New Sparta. It's about noon, and it's          |   |  raining. Joe Smith is seated on a bench,       |   |  along with a cop.)                             |   |                                                 |   |  Joe: Oh, how I wish it would stop raining! I   |   |       grow weary of this foul weather.          |   |                                                 |   |  Cop: Actually, I like this rain. It gives me   |   |       an excuse to sit in the 7-11 and eat      |   |       donuts.                                   |   |                                                 |   |  Joe: Yes, you would like that.                 |   |                                                 |   |   (A high pitched scream pierces the silence.)  |   |                                                 |   |  Joe: What the hell was that? Is somebody       |   |       trying to kill Abe again?                 |   |                                                 |   |  Cop: I don't know. I'll go check it out.       |   |       (The cop stands up, and hurries down      |   |       the street.)                              |   |                                                 |   |  Joe: (To himself) I think I'm heading home.    |   |       (He gets up to leave.)                    |   |                                                 |   x-------------------------------------------------x

Objects.Name: script second 2 two
Objects.ShortDescription: the second page of a script
Objects.Description: The second page of a play script is lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: x-------------------------------------------------x   |                                            pg 2 |   |                                                 |   |  (A street vendor dashes out from behind a      |   |  building, and rushes over to Joe)              |   |                                                 |   |  Vendor: Good afternoon good sir! May I inter-  |   |          est you in this beautiful gold watch?  |   |          (The vendor pulls out a gold watch     |   |          from his pocket, obviously one of      |   |          many.)                                 |   |                                                 |   |  Joe: Is it stolen? It doesn't matter anyway,   |   |       I don't need another watch. Besides, I    |   |       don't even any money right now.           |   |                                                 |   |  Vendor: (Snarling) Look son, I want to sell    |   |          you this watch. It's not stolen, and   |   |          it's only 50 coins, a very reasonable  |   |          price.                                 |   |                                                 |   |  Joe: That's true, it is a reasonable price.    |   |       My answer is still no.                    |   |                                                 |   |  Vendor: Ok, this is what I'm going to do. (He  |   |          reaches inside his coat and pulls      |   |          out a switchblade.) You're going to    |   |          buy this watch, or I'll cut you        |   |          bitch. I've got 5 kids to feed.        |   |                                                 |   x-------------------------------------------------x

Objects.Name: script third 3 three
Objects.ShortDescription: the third page of a script
Objects.Description: The third page of a script is lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: x-------------------------------------------------x   |                                            pg 3 |   |                                                 |   |  Joe: Put that shit away man. I told you, I     |   |       don't have the money for that.            |   |                                                 |   |  Vendor: That's it. (He slashes Joe with his    |   |          knife, cutting him in the arm.)        |   |                                                 |   |  Joe: Help! Police! I'm being murdered!         |   |                                                 |   |  Vendor: Shut the hell up. You're gonna be      |   |          sorry you didn't buy this from me.     |   |          (He puts the watch away, and pulls out |   |          a handgun. He cocks the trigger, and   |   |          points it at Joe's chest.)             |   |                                                 |   |  Joe: No!!!!                                    |   |                                                 |   |  Vendor: Good-bye, friend. (He pulls the        |   |          trigger, and the bullet rips through)  |   |          Joe's body.)                           |   |                                                 |   |  Joe: (Falling to the ground.) You bastard.     |   |       How unfair life can be! (He dies.)        |   |                                                 |   |  Vendor: Haha! Hopefully the next customer      |   |          will be more cooperative!              |   |                                                 |   |                  T H E   E N D                  |   |                                                 |   x-------------------------------------------------x

Objects.Name: mop
Objects.Description: A wooden handled mop has been left here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This looks like a very useful mop.  It has a soft cloth end, which looks likeit would be great at washing a floor.  The wooden handle is quite thick andhard.  It would make an idea weapon.

Objects.Name: broom curling
Objects.Description: A plastic curling broom has been left.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This is a curling broom.  It has a long thin plastic handle, and an endconsisting of rough fabric stretched over a piece of foam attached to a woodenblock.  Curlers use these to sweep the ice in front of the rocks.

Objects.Name: red curling rock
Objects.Description: A red curling rock has been left here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: The curling rock is made of a gray stone, and has a red handle and redstripes on it.  It feels quite heavy.

Objects.Name: yellow curling rock
Objects.Description: A yellow curling rock has been left here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: The curling rock is made of a gray stone, and has a yellow handle and yellowstripes on it.  It feels quite heavy.

Objects.Name: coffee cup coffee
Objects.Description: A cup of coffee has been set here.

Objects.Name: hamburger burger
Objects.Description: A tasty looking hamburger has been left here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This hamburger was made at the Newbie Zoo.  It's still in its foil wrapper,so it's still warm.

Objects.Name: poutine box cheesy
Objects.Description: A box of cheesy poutine has been left here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This box of poutine is quite large.  For those who don't know, poutine iscomposed of french fries covered with gravy and cheese curds.

Objects.Name: hotdog foot long foot-long
Objects.Description: A foot-long is lying here.
Objects.ExtraDescription: This hot dog was made at the Newbie Zoo.  It looks pretty tasty.

Objects.Name: water bottle water
Objects.Description: A bottle of water has been left here.

Objects.Name: bag potato chips
Objects.Description: A bag of potato chips has been left here.

Objects.Name: box pretzels
Objects.Description: A box of pretzels is here.

Objects.Name: sturdy key
Objects.Description: A sturdy key is lying here.

Objects.Name: silver key
Objects.Description: A shiny silver key has been left here.
